name: UIBarItem
desc: An abstract superclass for items that you can add to a bar that appears at the bottom of the screen.

items.name: init()
items.desc: Initializes the bar item to its default state.

items.name: var title: String?
items.desc: The title displayed on the item.

items.name: var image: UIImage?
items.desc: The image used to represent the item.

items.name: var landscapeImagePhone: UIImage?
items.desc: The image to use to represent the item in landscape orientation when using the iPhone appearance idiom.

items.name: var largeContentSizeImage: UIImage?
items.desc: The image to display for users who are blind or have low vision.

items.name: var imageInsets: UIEdgeInsets
items.desc: The image inset or outset for each edge.

items.name: var landscapeImagePhoneInsets: UIEdgeInsets
items.desc: The image inset or outset for each edge of the image in landscape orientation when using the iPhone appearance idiom.

items.name: var largeContentSizeImageInsets: UIEdgeInsets
items.desc: The insets to apply to the bar item's large image when displaying the image in an assistive UI.

items.name: var isEnabled: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the item is enabled.

items.name: var tag: Int
items.desc: The receiver’s tag, an application-supplied integer that you can use to identify bar item objects in your application.

items.name: func setTitleTextAttributes([NSAttributedString.Key : Any]?, for: UIControl.State)
items.desc: Sets the title’s text attributes for a given control state.

items.name: func titleTextAttributes(for: UIControl.State) -> [NSAttributedString.Key : Any]?
items.desc: Returns the title’s text attributes for a given control state.
